big_picture_notes: 1 John advances assurance through spiral progression (ringing repetition) across three interlocking themes: Light/Righteousness (obedience), Love (fraternal charity), and Truth (confession of the Son). The discourse cycles via antithetical parallelism (light/darkness; God/world; truth/error) and repeated markers (‘By this we know…’, ‘My little children…’) that frame tests of life: doctrinal (Jesus Christ come in the flesh), moral (keeping commandments), and social (loving the brothers). Inclusios tie the work together (1:4 with 5:13; knowledge/knowing), while purpose is pastoral: confident fellowship and eternal life.

stories.story_title: The Reality of Fellowship: Light, Obedience, and Antichrist
stories.why_start_end_and_literary_glue: Start (1:1) apostolic ‘from the beginning’ witness sets authority; end (2:28) hortatory ‘abide in him’ closes the first cycle before the children‑of‑God focus. Glue: antithetical parallelism (three ‘if we say…’), ‘little children’ address, and abiding/anointing motifs.

scenes.scene_name: Prologue: Witnessing the Word of Life
scenes.why_start_end_and_devices: From the beginning, heard/seen/handled—koinonia aim so joy may be complete. Devices: eyewitness anaphora (sensory verbs), fellowship/purpose statement.

scenes.scene_name: The Message of Light and Tests of Walking
scenes.why_start_end_and_devices: ‘God is light’ → triple antithesis (if we say…) resolved by confession and cleansing. Devices: alternating antithetical parallelism, confession/cleansing pair.
My little children—Christ our Advocate/propitiation; knowing shown by keeping commands; walk as he walked. Devices: legal metaphor (Paraclete), ‘know’ chain, abiding duty.
Not new yet new—love; hater in darkness, blinded. Devices: paradox (old/new), light/dark ethics, chiastic feel around brother love.

scenes.scene_name: Reasons for Writing to God’s Family
scenes.why_start_end_and_devices: I write to you… little children/fathers/young men—sins forgiven, know him, overcome the evil one. Devices: anaphora, tricolon audience with parallel reasons.
Lust of flesh/eyes, pride of life—world passing; doing God’s will abides forever. Devices: vice triad vs abiding contrast, sharp antithesis.
Last hour; they went out; deny the Son → have not the Father. Devices: eschatological time‑note, departure metaphor, doctrinal antithesis Son/Father.
Let what you heard abide; anointing teaches; abide to have confidence at his coming. Devices: anointing/abiding leitwörter, parousia motivation.

stories.story_title: The Imperative of Righteousness: The Children of God vs. The World
stories.why_start_end_and_literary_glue: Start (2:29) knowing the Righteous One → born of him grounds the moral cycle; end (4:6) test‑of‑spirits resolves with ‘from God’ vs ‘from the world’. Glue: born‑of‑God vs of‑the‑devil/world antitheses; practice language (doing sin vs righteousness); assurance ‘by this we know’.

scenes.scene_name: Hope of God’s Children and Purification
scenes.why_start_end_and_devices: Behold what love—now God’s children; when he appears we shall be like him; purify oneself as he is pure. Devices: behold exclamation, future likeness, purification motif.

scenes.scene_name: Practice of Sin vs Abiding Righteousness
scenes.why_start_end_and_devices: Sin is lawlessness; practicing sin of the devil; born of God does not keep on sinning; doing righteousness of God. Devices: practice verb repetition, birth of God logic, stark antithesis.
Not loving brother ≠ of God; Cain as negative exemplar; love in deed and truth. Devices: exemplum (Cain/Abel), rhetorical question on God’s love abiding, practical charity demand.
By this we know—hearts reassured; command: believe and love; Spirit given confirms abiding. Devices: assurance refrain, two‑command summary, indwelling witness.
Do not believe every spirit; confess Jesus Christ come in the flesh; we are from God—spirit of truth vs error. Devices: confessional formula, ‘from God/world’ polarity, antichrist identification.

stories.story_title: The Completion of Love: The Two Commands and Eternal Life
stories.why_start_end_and_literary_glue: Start (4:7) beloved—let us love one another begins the climactic love cycle; end (5:21) final imperative ‘guard yourselves from idols’ closes with fidelity to the true God. Glue: repeated ‘love’ and ‘abide’, internal/external witness (Spirit/water/blood), and epistolary ‘these things I write…’ assurance.

scenes.scene_name: God Is Love; Love Perfected Among Us
scenes.why_start_end_and_devices: Love one another; God is love; he sent his Son—therefore we ought to love; his love perfected in us. Devices: theological definition, causal chain, perfection theme.
By this we know—Spirit given; confess the Son; as he is, so are we—confidence for the day. Devices: assurance marker, confession motif, judgment boldness.

scenes.scene_name: No Fear in Perfect Love; Commands Not Burdensome
scenes.why_start_end_and_devices: There is no fear in love; we love because he first loved; love God and brother; his commands are not burdensome. Devices: fear/love antithesis, liar exposure, obedience/love inclusio.

scenes.scene_name: Victory of Faith and the Three Witnesses
scenes.why_start_end_and_devices: Born of God overcomes the world; who believes Jesus is the Son; Spirit, water, blood testify; whoever has the Son has life. Devices: victory lexeme, testimony triad, life/son possession antithesis.

scenes.scene_name: Epilogue: Confidence, Sin, and Final Warning
scenes.why_start_end_and_devices: I write these things… that you may know you have life; confident prayer; sin to death vs not; three ‘we know’ declarations; guard yourselves from idols. Devices: purpose inclusio, tricolon ‘we know’, abrupt final imperative.
